text: Culture of <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells

PB <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T-cell populations were resuspended at a density of 1 x 106 cells / ml in culture medium with 10 % FCS , and 0.5 ml cell suspensions were dispensed into the wells of 24-well microtiter plates ( Coster ) coated with 1 mug / ml anti-CD3 mAb ( Immunotech , Marseille , France ) .

The cells were incubated with 1 mug / ml anti - <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mAb ( Immunotech ) in the presence or absence of the indicated concentrations of <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Becton Dickinson , San Jose , CA , USA ) at 37degreesC in a humidified atmosphere containing 5 % CO2 [ 28 ] .
Culture supernatants were collected 36 hours later and cell-free samples were stored at - 30degreesC until cytokine assay .

To examine the effect of <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on T-cell responsiveness to <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells from healthy controls were incubated in culture medium with 10 % FCS in the presence or absence of 10 ng / ml <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Becton Dickinson ) for 36 hours .

Cells were then stimulated for 36 hours with anti-CD3 mAb and anti - <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mAb in the presence or absence of 1 ng / ml <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Culture supernatants were measured for <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> concentrations .
